commit_message:
Remove usage of the reserved keyword id

There are places in the code where id is being assigned to a variable,
overwritting the reserved keyword.

This patch renames those variables as to not overwrite the keyword.

Change-Id: I1af1f1904b060c191752c87016ed2e303b3f70fc
Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
update required kernel

The required kernel was set to 4.2 though that's not an option in
xenial. This change updates the required kernel to 4.4.

Change-Id: I09c4c241f0c4ba1e62a34d76fd3f7ce8d6486c6f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 72a9838583231dd78ad56342aaee2f2af29358cc)

commit_message:
Add release note for nova_default_schedule_zone

Change Iacaa9785bf7ec7bebe2e0eb69e304bcfab41df5c implemented a change
in defaults, but did not include a release note. This patch adds a
release note to inform deployers of the change.

Change-Id: Ia7f175b3655733f0868f52caff417a262bb14ecb
Related-Bug: 1730918
Signed-off-by: Kevin Lefevre <kevin.lefevre@osones.io>
(cherry picked from commit 7fe8c36df0876a19877a078db8ba13204daacaa9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/76/556976/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | The default variable `nova_default_schedule_zone` was previously set by default to ``nova``. This default has been removed to allow the default to be set by the nova code instead. Deployers wishing to maintain the default availability zone of nova must now set the variable as a user_variables.yml or group_vars override.

commit_message:
Fix routings headers

The current implementation that remaps the headers of jobs objects
fails in python3. This change simplify the implementation and fixes
the current failures.

Change-Id: I6620a8aeff2b678ab07ae9a55ef2f1e481bdef5d

commit_message:
Add release note for nova_default_schedule_zone

Change Iacaa9785bf7ec7bebe2e0eb69e304bcfab41df5c implemented a change
in defaults, but did not include a release note. This patch adds a
release note to inform deployers of the change.

Change-Id: Ia7f175b3655733f0868f52caff417a262bb14ecb

added_lines: --- features: - | Remove default variable `nova_default_schedule_zone` previously set by default to `nova`. This prevent error when default AZ is not named nova or if there are no host in the nova AZ. AZ scheduling will be done randomly if no AZ is specified by the user. This is nova default behavior.

commit_message:
WIP: Replace live migration steps and delays with memory iteration logic

Change-Id: Ic47ae0147aebe4151544832bd8b1bf8b37beb9a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/39/443339/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================== Memory iteration based live migration ===================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/memory-iteration-based-live-migration Replace the current logic of calculating live-migration progress that is based on steps, delays and timer with more simpler logic based on memory iterations. Problem description =================== Nova tries to ensure the maximum liveness of a VM during the live-migration process and it is based on following libvirt config options: * ``live_migration_downtime`` - Maximum permitted downtime, in milliseconds, for live migration switchover. * ``live_migration_downtime_steps`` - Number of incremental steps to reach max downtime value. * ``live_migration_downtime_delay`` - Time to wait, in seconds, between each step increase of the migration downtime. All these options and its usage is very complicated and require deep knowledge by end user to properly tune it for their cluster. With current complexity and default values ``live_migration_completion_timeout`` will hit even before VM reach maximum ``live_migration_downtime``. Use Cases --------- As an operator, I want simple and easy to understand process to rampup for live-migration maximum downtime . Proposed change =============== Deprecate the current config options ``live_migration_downtime_steps`` and ```live_migration_downtime_delay` to calculate the steps and delay in live-migration process and replace it with a new single config option ``live_migration_iterations_to_max_downtime`` based on memory iterations. This option describes the number of iterations required to reach the maximum permitted downtime for live migration switchover, as defined by ``live_migration_downtime``. TODO: Add more here Alternatives ------------ Keep using the current available options. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployers should understand the usage of new config options to tune their live-migration operations. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Sarafraj Singh (raj_singh) Other contributors: OSIC Work Items ---------- * Add new config options in libvirt. * Add logic in libvirt to use these new options to ramp up to maximum downtime of any VM. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add unit tests to cover any new code added or replaced. * Add a tempest test to ensure this logic is working. Documentation Impact ==================== All new config options should be documented for end user to understand and fine tune it for their environments. References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Pike - Introduced

subject: Implement use-service-catalog-for-endpoints differently
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-18 17:51:10.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/use-service-catalog-for-endpoints.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/8323bfd260ddcf633b1f72dd036c91d75d3a57c4', 'message': "Implement use-service-catalog-for-endpoints differently

Configuring a service_type that is not the official service type for a
service is a mess, and something that should not be necessary. Update
the spec to indicate that default service_type values should be used in
the absence of an override (although against my better judgement leave
the option to configure one as a get-out-of-jail card) In order to do
that cleanly, also ditch the concept of a single value that is a colon
separated tuple, since that form is not used to indicate an OpenStack
service pretty much anywhere else. Remove the service_name completely,
as it's completely pointless in a Nova config.

Also, mention that instead of implementing code directly in Nova to do
some of the grosser logic needed for this, that we can just use
os-client-config which already does all of the logic required.

Change-Id: Iaa0ba24331c3d506ce34607b369c85868cdfc9d7
"}]
commit_message:
Implement use-service-catalog-for-endpoints differently

Configuring a service_type that is not the official service type for a
service is a mess, and something that should not be necessary. Update
the spec to indicate that default service_type values should be used in
the absence of an override (although against my better judgement leave
the option to configure one as a get-out-of-jail card) In order to do
that cleanly, also ditch the concept of a single value that is a colon
separated tuple, since that form is not used to indicate an OpenStack
service pretty much anywhere else. Remove the service_name completely,
as it's completely pointless in a Nova config.

Also, mention that instead of implementing code directly in Nova to do
some of the grosser logic needed for this, that we can just use
os-client-config which already does all of the logic required.

Change-Id: Iaa0ba24331c3d506ce34607b369c85868cdfc9d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/47/457747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Add two config settings for each service called ``service_type`` and ``interface``. For instance:: [glance] service_type = image interface = public If ``service_type`` is not given, it should default to the well-known key in the `Service Type Authority`_. If ``interface`` is not given, it should default to ``internal``... _Service Type Authority: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/service-types-authority/ Special Note about Cinder ------------------------- Cinder finds itself in a special place, as it has historically used either `volume`, `volumev2` or `volumev3` in the keystone catalog. Additionally, it is being proposed that `block-storage` be its new ``service_type`` in the Service Type Authority. Assuming `block-storage` is accepted, ``service_type`` should default to ``block-storage``, but the new `get_service_url()` method should try, in order, ``block-storage``, ``volumev3``, ``volumev2``. This will allow for backwards compat as well as rolling rollouts of the new names and versions. In order to figure out which version of Cinder is running, fetching the Cinder version discovery document at startup and caching the results is recommended. Do not implement the logic for ``get_service_url()`` in Nova at all and instead use `os-client-config`_ which already handles the logic of getting a configured Client object for any service keyed on ``service_type``. .. _os-client-config: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/os-client-config
deleted_lines: For example, the ``catalog_info = volume:cinder:public`` in nova.conf is a configuration setting to set the info to match when looking for cinder in the service catalog. Format used here is:: <service_type>:<service_name>:<interfacinterfaceNone

commit_message:
Few updates on server filter/sort spec

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params are missing in spec's whitelist:
 -  Add 'created_at' and 'change_since' in filter params list
 -  Add 'creacted_at' and 'updated_at' in sort param list

2. all_tenant Rule(old or new) should not change the API behvaiour
   Making new rule soft enforcement(no 403) actually changes the API
   behaviour and can break upgrade. This behaviour changes needs
   version bump.
   Details: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html

partial implement of bp add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters

Change-Id: I0d51037b99c023d63dc3bef63a9190b498cd87b8

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Change-Id: I69d9d1b8b5ea7c62425e1d38e7f551ebe3cc57c3
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2115c1c13e609c3f720c44f38f5562cead456373
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Create ovs temp directories when using ovs

This change creates a tmpfiles file and related directories when using
any "ovs" based plugin.

Change-Id: I616880bc6883eacb8393bbcaabaccccdd2665200
Closes-Bug: #1754144
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7ba9b763828155ba4ec639b92017061b013a2f5f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/90/556890/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Create ovs tempfiles directory block: - name: Create ovs tmpfiles file lineinfile: dest: "/etc/tmpfiles.d/openstack-openvswitch.conf" line: "D /var/run/openvswitch 2755 root root" create: true - name: Create ovs tmp directory file: path: "/var/run/openvswitch" state: directory mode: "02755" when: - "'ovs' in neutron_plugin_type | lower"

commit_message:
table: Show checkbox only when there is BatchAction

Checkbox in a table assumes BatchAction.
 This commit checks whether at least one BatchAction is
 included as table actions and displays checkboxes
 only when BatchAction is available.

Change-Id: Ia1cba6c59f5d40f7df7f4b98a9f459a6934cfbb7
Closes-Bug: #1744742
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/00/527900/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from horizon.tables.actions import BatchAction batch_actions = [action for action in bound_actions if isinstance(action, BatchAction)] self.set_multiselect_column_visibility(len(batch_actions) > 0)

commit_message:
User-controlled SR-IOV ports allocation

A proposal for user-controlled SR-IOV ports allocation
on Physical Functions (PFs).

Co-Authored-By: Moshe Levi <moshele@mellanox.com>

Blueprint: user-controlled-sriov-ports-allocation
Change-Id: I926d4d950b5de99e52eb353787a794f641caf9f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/42/182242/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== NIC bonding support for SRIOV ports ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-sriov-nic-bonding In certain scenarios an additional HA for networking might be required for a guest that could be achieved by bonding NIC inside of a guest. Problem description =================== The single root I/O virtualization (SR-IOV) allows a PCI device provide a number of functions within the same device, specifically, there's a Physical Function (PF) that's a primary function of the device, and a number of Virtual Functions (VF) within this device, each of VFs could be associated with a network port and passed to a guest using PCI passthrough. OpenStack does support SR-IOV ports, however, it gives no control to user on how VFs will be distributed across PFs. Moreover, with the current implementation, if a host has multiple PFs, VFs will be allocated in a linear fashion. There's a proposal suggested to distribute VF allocation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142094/ However, it still gives no control to user and is just a best-effort attempt to allocate VFs in an optimal way. Use Cases ---------- Consider a situation when user wants to run a guest connected to multiple networks. Additionally, he wants to have a failover for each of these connections; failover could be achieved by passing two ports for each network to a guest and building a bond on top of these interfaces. However, in current scenario, where user cannot control VF placement, he can create 4 ports (2 networks with 2 ports per network in a guest), however, there's no guarantee that ports for the same network will be allocated on different PFs. And in case if they're allocated on the same PF it makes bonding not very useful. Project Priority ----------------- Does not directly address Liberty priorities. Proposed change =============== The main steps would be: * Add 'bindings:dev_group' attribute for Neutron ports. It would be an arbitrary string with name of a device group. Devices in the same group will have to be allocated on different PFs. Scope of a device_group is a single guest. Optionally, meaning of the 'dev_group' attribute could be extended. For example, it could hold a JSON with group description, e.g.: {"name": "dev_group1", "policy": "affinity"} to give even more control. * Nova modification to obtain the device group information from Neutron for SRIOV ports and allocate VFs accordingly. * Nova-scheduler needs to be modified to properly calculate required number of PCI devices for a given request. For example, if we have two sriov ports requested for a guest, we just check if we have 2 VFs available. However, it's not enough when these ports have the same device group value, and the requirement should be to have a host with 2 PFs that have at least 1 VF available. In case when 'dev_group' is not specified the default behavior doesn't change. Alternatives ------------ All the other ways of achieving the specified goals that were found either introduce API changes and/or data model changes or do not preserve backward capability. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Users will be able to control how VFs are allocated in their setups using SRIOV. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Roman Bogorodskiy <novel> Other contributors: Nikolay Starodubtsev <starodubcevna> Work Items ---------- * Addition of the 'dev_group' attribute for Neutron * Nova's dev_group processing and VF allocation code modification * Nova's scheduler code modification Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= The changes to the selection logic are testable through unit testing, as is the extension to the PCI request API. Integration and system testing will require 3rd party CI as it will require specific hardware configurations to properly test. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== * Previous change request: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151260/1 * Distribute PCI Requests Across Multiple Devices: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142094/ History ======= Optional section for liberty intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Liberty - Introduced

subject: Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-19 22:10:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/yaql/commit/dbc158d976acde36d8812ce8d280719785e9a6e5', 'message': 'Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible

The behaviour of the groupBy() function was fixed in 1.1.2 by
3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025 to pass only the list of values
to be aggregated to the aggregator function, instead of passing both the
key and the list of values (and expecting both the key and the
aggregated value to be returned). This fix was incompatible with
existing expressions that used the aggregator argument to groupBy().

In the event of an error, fall back trying the previous syntax and see
if something plausible gets returned. If not, re-raise the original error.
This should mean that pre-existing expressions will continue to work,
while most outright bogus expressions should fail in a manner consistent
with the correct definition of the function.

Change-Id: Ic6c54be4ed99003fe56cf1a5329f3f1d84fd43c8
Closes-Bug: #1750032

The behaviour of the groupBy() function was fixed in 1.1.2 by
3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025 to pass only the list of values
to be aggregated to the aggregator function, instead of passing both the

In the event of an error, fall back trying the previous syntax and see

This should mean that pre-existing expressions will continue to work,
while most outright bogus expressions should fail in a manner consistent

Change-Id: Ic6c54be4ed99003fe56cf1a5329f3f1d84fd43c8
Closes-Bug: #1750032
'}]
commit_message:
Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible

The behaviour of the groupBy() function was fixed in 1.1.2 by
3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025 to pass only the list of values
to be aggregated to the aggregator function, instead of passing both the
key and the list of values (and expecting both the key and the
aggregated value to be returned). This fix was incompatible with
existing expressions that used the aggregator argument to groupBy().

In the event of an error, fall back trying the previous syntax and see
if something plausible gets returned. If not, re-raise the original error.
This should mean that pre-existing expressions will continue to work,
while most outright bogus expressions should fail in a manner consistent
with the correct definition of the function.

Change-Id: Ic6c54be4ed99003fe56cf1a5329f3f1d84fd43c8
Closes-Bug: #1750032
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/yaql refs/changes/96/545996/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_group_by_old_syntax(self): # Test the syntax used in 1.1.1 and earlier, where the aggregator # function was passed the key as well as the value list, and returned # the key along with the aggregated value. This ensures backward # compatibility with existing expressions. data = {'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': 1, 'd': 3, 'e': 2} self.assertItemsEqual( [[1, 'ac'], [2, 'be'], [3, 'd']], self.eval('$.items().orderBy($[0]).' 'groupBy($[1], $[0], [$[0], $[1].sum()])', data=data)) self.assertItemsEqual( [[1, ['a', 1, 'c', 1]], [2, ['b', 2, 'e', 2]], [3, ['d', 3]]], self.eval('$.items().orderBy($[0]).' 'groupBy($[1],, [$[0], $[1].sum()])', data=data)) self.assertItemsEqual( [[1, ['a', 1, 'c', 1]], [2, ['b', 2, 'e', 2]], [3, ['d', 3]]], self.eval('$.items().orderBy($[0]).' 'groupBy($[1], aggregator => [$[0], $[1].sum()])', data=data))

commit_message:
Fix UpdateLRouterPortCommand to work with OVS 2.8

The UpdateLRouterPortCommand was broken when used with OVS <= 2.8 due
to the ipv6_ra_configs column not existing in the OVNDB schema.

This patch is adding a check on that command to ignore that column if
it's not present. A TODO was left as a comment so we don't forget to
remove this check once the support for older OVS versions are dropped.

Change-Id: I1ce87173731146e3f0078df99b7ba56f44b14497
Closes-Bug: #1757438
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/30/554930/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not lrouter_port: # TODO(lucasagomes): Remove this check once we drop the support # for OVS versions <= 2.8 ipv6_ra_configs_supported = self.api.is_col_present( 'Logical_Router_Port', 'ipv6_ra_configs') for col, val in self.columns.items(): if col == 'ipv6_ra_configs' and not ipv6_ra_configs_supported: continue if col == 'gateway_chassis': col, val = _add_gateway_chassis(self.api, txn, self.name, val) setattr(lrouter_port, col, val)
deleted_lines: if lrouter_port: for col, val in self.columns.items(): if col == 'gateway_chassis': col, val = _add_gateway_chassis(self.api, txn, self.name, val) setattr(lrouter_port, col, val)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary configuration

If none are specified, a default set is used.
The default set is equal to --config-file in here.
So I think --config-file is unnecessary

Change-Id: I5c629b10c1e715f277e0455d6809de1fd43c9181

commit_message:
Load networks and security groups in parallel

We need both networks and security groups info on the port details page.
To speedup page loading we loads this data in parallel using futurist
library

Partial-implements: blueprint fetch-resources-in-parallel
Change-Id: Id51f4d0b4c90e8dd1f72366b9edf6b98ec6ce6f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/11/495911/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import futurist @memoized.memoized_method def _get_network(network_id): try: network = api.neutron.network_get(self.request, network_id) except Exception: network = {} msg = _('Unable to retrieve network details.') exceptions.handle(self.request, msg) return network @memoized.memoized_method def _get_security_groups(sg_ids): # Avoid extra API calls if no security group is associated. if not sg_ids: return [] try: security_groups = api.neutron.security_group_list(self.request, id=sg_ids) except Exception: security_groups = [] msg = _("Unable to retrieve security groups for the port.") exceptions.handle(self.request, msg) port.security_groups = security_groups with futurist.ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=2) as e: fut = e.submit(fn=_get_network, network_id=port.network_id) e.submit(fn=_get_security_groups, sg_ids=port.security_groups) network = fut.result()
deleted_lines: @memoized.memoized_method def get_network(self, network_id): try: network = api.neutron.network_get(self.request, network_id) except Exception: network = {} msg = _('Unable to retrieve network details.') exceptions.handle(self.request, msg) return network @memoized.memoized_method def get_security_groups(self, sg_ids): # Avoid extra API calls if no security group is associated. if not sg_ids: return [] try: security_groups = api.neutron.security_group_list(self.request, id=sg_ids) except Exception: security_groups = [] msg = _("Unable to retrieve security groups for the port.") exceptions.handle(self.request, msg) return security_groups network = self.get_network(port.network_id) port.security_groups = self.get_security_groups(port.security_groups)

commit_message:
Dell EMC PS: Fix the driver path

The Dell EMC PS driver's path
cinder.volume.drivers.eqlx.DellEQLSanISCSIDriver is deprecated,
update to new path
cinder.volume.drivers.dell_emc.ps.PSSeriesISCSIDriver

Closes Bug: #1758133

Change-Id: Ia676610fc22da31202133497b7ed0fae66e7ac1c

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-26 13:00:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/commit/ef0678646440b69a2da4bdf83a853d11326e0784', 'message': 'Have run_tests clone the test repo

commit_message:
Have run_tests clone the test repo

Current run_tests.sh executes another script (tests-repo-clone.sh)
to clone the tests repo. That script therefore has to be replicated
out to all the other repositories too.

In order to try to reduce the footprint of things that need to be
replicated out to the repositories, we fold the tests repo clone
into run_tests.sh and move the clone of the previous tests repo
into the common test script. We also remove the conditional for
the previous test repo clone as it does no harm to always have it.

To reduce the maintenance when creating new branches, we key the
branch to be cloned by run_tests.sh to the content in the .gitreview
file. This way as soon as a branch is created and that file is
updated, the right branch is cloned and the system becomes self
maintaining.

Some extra comments are added to explain the purpose of variables/
commands and the install_pkg_deps function is changed to just be
in line script as the function is no re-used anywhere else.

We change the set vars in the common script to add x and remove v
to reduce the output verbosity and only output the useful stuff.

Finally, the linters job definition is changed so that it uses
run_tests.sh to execute the lint tests. This simplifies the job
definition and also ensures that zuul runs tests in the same way
that humans do.

Change-Id: I9f26f4f438715ce6361cc9960f58f2d256c5a839
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/18/556518/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/tests-repo-clone.sh" bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/tests-repo-clone.sh" bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/tests-repo-clone.sh" bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/tests-repo-clone.sh"# This is here due to a bug in the ubuntu-xenial # job which does not do the translation from # 'func' to 'functional' for us. # TODO(odyssey4me): # Remove this once https://review.openstack.org/512351 # has been merged. [testenv:func] deps = {[testenv:ansible]deps} commands = bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/tests-repo-clone.sh" bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh" bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/tests-repo-clone.sh"

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I123055f6eb0a653803ac2b574ea6c87bee707256
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Create ovs temp directories when using ovs

This change creates a tmpfiles file and related directories when using
any "ovs" based plugin.

Change-Id: I616880bc6883eacb8393bbcaabaccccdd2665200
Closes-Bug: #1754144
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[Functional tests] Add gateway add/delete/flush tests

This commit adds functional tests for add/delete/flush/get
gateway IP methods from ip_lib.IpRouteCommand class.

Change-Id: I59d2361a849660a6a67ed56a5be52ee0e88d6e4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/34/555834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_gateway_lifecycle(self): attr = self.generate_device_details( ip_cidrs=["%s/24" % TEST_IP, "fd00::1/64"] ) metric = 1000 device = self.manage_device(attr) device_ip = attr.ip_cidrs[0].split('/')[0] expected_gateway = { 'metric': metric, 'gateway': device_ip} device.route.add_gateway(device_ip, metric) configured_gateway = device.route.get_gateway() self.assertEqual(expected_gateway, configured_gateway) device.route.delete_gateway(device_ip) self.assertIsNone(device.route.get_gateway()) def test_gateway_flush(self): attr = self.generate_device_details( ip_cidrs=["%s/24" % TEST_IP, "fd00::1/64"] ) device = self.manage_device(attr) gateways = { constants.IP_VERSION_4: attr.ip_cidrs[0].split('/')[0], constants.IP_VERSION_6: "fd00::ff" } for ip_version, gateway_ip in gateways.items(): # Ensure that there is no gateway configured self.assertIsNone( device.route.get_gateway(ip_version=ip_version)) # Now lets add gateway device.route.add_gateway(gateway_ip, table="main") self.assertIsNotNone( device.route.get_gateway(ip_version=ip_version)) # Flush gateway and check that there is no any gateway configured device.route.flush(ip_version, table="main") self.assertIsNone( device.route.get_gateway(ip_version=ip_version))

commit_message:
refactoring vitrage processes

oslo service replaced by cotyledon.
Motivation:
Oslo service uses eventlet and green threads for timers and threads.
In Vitrage we use real threads and multiprocessing, it seems this 
combination causes unexpected behavior (such as timers not running, 
processes not starting) so the entire solution is very delicate to 
changes.

As part of an ongoing effort (previously, monkeypatching was removed)
this commit solves issues encountered in rpc_collector commit in 
addition it removes unnecessary complications in the application.

Co-Authored-By: Eyal <eyal.bar-ilan@nokia.com>
Change-Id: If33708e128d7aeb420a9aa79f71cfccd2b48dfb3

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I7ec32aefc9caac30f4e93704fc33b9a98cb1c622
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Services: Add support for K8S service's port edit use case

Kubernetes supports edit operation for API resources.
This patch extends service handler to support edit operation
of  K8S service's port field.

Change-Id: I286dd8a1383de8eda78637d455e6f8035f178c02
Closes-Bug: 1684096

subject: Apply haproxy vars to haproxy group instead of haproxy_all
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 11:20:00.000000000', 'files': ['inventory/group_vars/haproxy/haproxy.yml', 'inventory/group_vars/haproxy/keepalived.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/85714acedb50ea65d7e7684c127984c8dc56afe4', 'message': "Apply haproxy vars to haproxy group instead of haproxy_all

Any ansible command loads the group vars/host vars.
If haproxy group isn't properly loaded with hosts, the whole
group_vars/haproxy_all/keepalived.yml will fail to get an index
for any host belonging to the group.

Instead the index should search in the group in which the variable
applies to, to ensure it's always the same kind of group.

Change-Id: Id489b3f337ea0db0be0008477c9e3afde3872004
Closes-Bug: #1752932
(cherry picked from commit ca8e8fc90abc08e9080a16d5b9fa3fc5a93c29bb)
"}]
commit_message:
Apply haproxy vars to haproxy group instead of haproxy_all

Any ansible command loads the group vars/host vars.
If haproxy group isn't properly loaded with hosts, the whole
group_vars/haproxy_all/keepalived.yml will fail to get an index
for any host belonging to the group.

Instead the index should search in the group in which the variable
applies to, to ensure it's always the same kind of group.

In a later commit, we should make sure the index is always done when
group size is bigger than 0.

Change-Id: Id489b3f337ea0db0be0008477c9e3afde3872004
Closes-Bug: #1752932
(cherry picked from commit ca8e8fc90abc08e9080a16d5b9fa3fc5a93c29bb)

commit_message:
Retain the ordering when using with MultiStringOp

When using config_template with a MultiStringOp the order was subject to
change because of the use of set theory. This change converts the use of
sets to tuples which allow us to retain the ability to override options
without losing the ordering of keys.

Change-Id: Id0bba86629a33ce74528c0bd51b11183f5315d86
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 662a2805c0dce43a1efec31a85e09056207ec3d2)

commit_message:
Support volume_type with BDM paramter

Currently when creating a new instance with boot from volume,
user only can choose volume_size.
the volume to be attached as a root is the volume type defined
in default_volume_type of cinder configuration in multi backed
environments. In other words, the user cannot select the root
volume type as the desired volume type.

blueprint support-volume-type-with-bdm-parameter

Change-Id: Id994aa3e12581c211031ccd15fc85ce8987ddde1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/95/466595/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================= Support volume type with BDM paramter ======================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/support-volume-type-with-bdm-parameter Problem description =================== Currently when creating a new instance with boot from volume, user only can choose volume_size. The volume to be attached as a root isthe volume type defined in default_volume_type of cinder configuration in multi backed environments. In other words, the user cannot select the root volume type as the desired volume type. Use Cases --------- * A end user wants to create instance with specific type of volume in multi backend environments. * QoS of the root volume is defined by volume type. When creating an instance, a end user wants to select the QoS of the root volume. Proposed change =============== A new optional paramter added to block_device_mapping_v2. The value of volume_type would be set to none by defaut. If destination_type is volume, user could specify the value of volume_type. The volume_type should be ignored unless destination_type is volume. We need to validate if the volume_type exist or not in the compute API. Alternatives ------------ * A user create volume from image with desired volume type. * Creating instance from the root volume. Data model impact ----------------- A new field will be added to the `block_device_mapping` DB table: * `volume_type`: This will be a NULLable field and default to NULL REST API impact --------------- Support 'volume_type' in os-block-device-mapping API. Proposed JSON request body for the new 'block_device_mapping_v2':: "block_device_mappong_v2": [ { "boot_index": "0", "source_type": "image", "destination_type": "volume", "volume_size": "40", "delete_on_termination": false, "tag":"disk1", "volume_type": "ceph" } ] "volume_type" can be a name/UUID of volume type. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The end user will be able to use 'volume_type' when creating VM with boot from volume. Performance Impact ------------------ There will be subtle performance impact because additional call to cinder to validate the volume_type passed in actually exists. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: John Haan <sjhan@netmarble.com> Work Items ---------- * Add new block_device_mapping_v2 parameter in Nova create API * Add volume_type schema in nova compute schema * Add volume_type attr in block_device_mapping object. * Add volume_type field in block_device_mapping table. * Add db migration file for adding volume_type field during db sync process. * Edit *BlockDevice class for adding volume_type in virt block_device. Dependencies ============ * The novaclient Testing ======= Add unit/functional/tempest tests Documentation Impact ==================== * Update the compute API reference documentation with block_device_mapping_v2 options References ========== History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Pike - Introduced

commit_message:
Add service-protected-server spec

Looks at how to use a service token to create a server locked to the
service, and the user is not allowed to manipulate the server in any
way.

Note - this is still a work in progress.

blueprint service-protected-server

Change-Id: Ib41cb0247c660d4f6b7327da1370e2c3f2974d74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/34/438134/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================== Servers locked by service ========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/locked-by-service This allows a service token to create a server that is locked to that service. This means it appears in the users server list, but the user is unable to delete that, they only see the name of the service user that locked the instance. Admin is able to override the service lock and clean up, if needed. Problem description =================== OpenStack services want to be able to create instances in a user's account, consuming their quota and being billed in a similar way to any other instance, but they server should not be able to access to delete that instance. Use Cases --------- Here is a typical service flow: * creates service locked instance, attaches to user's network and volumes. * resize above instance * snapshot above instance * delete instance * ensure the regular user and other service can't do any actions on a server Here is a related user flow: * User sees instance, and sees service that created it * Goes to related service to delete instance Here is a related admin flow: * Admin wants to live-migrate VM as normal during maintenance * Admin wants to delete an instance, if its found to be causing problems. Proposed change =============== Currently you can't create a server as locked. You have to first create the server, then call the lock action. Firstly we allow a user to pass ``"locked": True`` when creating a server. This stops there being a window where the user is not locked. Currently instance.locked_by is only expected to be ``admin`` or ``owner``. We need to expand that to include ``service``. This will only be allowed if the service token includes the appropriate role to pass a new ``is_service_lock`` policy rule, and the service_user_id matches. The locked instance is enforced by check_instance_lock in nova/compute/api.py Rather than only admins being able to perform actions on a locked server, we should also allow any matching service tokens to also perform actions on a service locked instance. For consistency we must ensure a service is able to unlock a server it has locked, admins are also allowed to unlock, but users are not allowed to unlock. NOTE: volumes and ports are not "locked" as part of this process. But those resources will be unable to be used by other instances while attached to the specified server. This is left as a follow up problem. TODO - double check all non-read actions like server update. Alternatives ------------ Its possible to create instances in a separate dedicated project, but it makes billing and visibility very hard to do well. Data model impact ----------------- TODO - need to store locked_by_user_id and locked_by_user_name so we can check the service matches when we check the service lock. REST API impact --------------- Modify the create_server API in a new microversion, so now takes: * ``"locked": True`` If ``is_servce_lock`` policy fails (checks a service token role) it is an owner lock, otherwise a service lock is applied. In another microversion we add support for this is server detail view: * ``"locked_by": "<instance.locked_by_user_name>"`` When it is an admin lock, the locked_by_user_name should just read ``"Administrator"`` Security impact --------------- TODO Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- There may be additional roles and service tokens that need to be configured in services that want to start using the new service lock concept. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: John Garbutt Other contributors: OSIC Work Items ---------- * Add locked param in create server API * Add database changes * Add new service lock concept to all lock APIs Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Need to add new functional tests to all API calls that check the lock to ensure it deals with the more complicated scenarios correctly. We need to add new tempest tests for the new APIs. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None History ======= Optional section intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Pike - Introduced

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Id469e90d53d52f13b596b71904604ec073289e88
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[DOCS] Update references for nspawn type containers

Now that the ability to use nspawn type containers has merged this patch
updates the deployer and reference documentation to cover the new
options.

Change-Id: Iac638c1f0f685abde9afa81cdc0a67f459da479f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add missing custom label declaration for limestone nodepool config

In a6dd6ff720b191eff0b0236f70e3b93c6b8d7f3f we changed the labels in
the provider configuration but we also need to add them here.

There's no need to set a min-ready key for these.

Change-Id: Ib653a493176da5bc64bc4587a2be3d3d8c4e3807

commit_message:
Remove driver-specific notes from extend api-ref

This is not part of the API contract.  It should
be documented elsewhere as a limitation of the
volume driver.

Change-Id: I3586853ce7e11150d54cc552863bd3d4f6db197b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/556577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. note:: Some volume backends require the storage to be in some multiple value rather than incremental. For example, the EMC ScaleIO backend requires storage in multiples of 8GB. There is a known limitation such that a request to extend the size of a volume for these backends will be rounded up to the nearest multiple but the actual physical size of the storage will not be reflected back in the API for the volume size. For example, a request to extend the size of an 8GB ScaleIO-backed volume to 9GB will actually result in 16GB of physical storage but only 9GB will be reflected in the API and counted for quota usage.

commit_message:
Honor {{role.name}}ExtraConfig with deprecated params

{{role.name}}ExtraConfig was previously ignored if the role used
deprecated params in roles_data.yaml. This was due to the usage of
server_resource_name in the ExtraConfig resource, where
service_resource_name also defaulted to
deprecated_service_resource_name. So, the new {{role.name}}ExtraConfig
was never actually used.

Change-Id: I83e57317e2c56260957be90c66290a41a926835a
Closes-Bug: #1758343

subject: Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-26 23:45:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/6402fcf452247c1aa96ffe3d16b611739e9ecb50', 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-27 03:41:34.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/test_controller_worker.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2', 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
'}]
commit_message:
Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/82/556682/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Marking it busy in the ' 'amphora health table to exclude it from health ' 'checks and skipping the failover.', amp.id) self._amphora_health_repo.update(db_apis.get_session(), amp.id, busy=True) return

commit_message:
Strip the trailing '.' from the fqdn dns record stored in OVN NB DB

Presently the dns fqdn record for a port is stored with trailing '.'
character. Eg. vm1.ovn.test."="10.0.0.4"

Fix this to store it as "vm1.ovn.test"="10.0.0.4"

Closes-bug: #1757074
Change-Id: I8cdc48065acdac9dcc5955c223824714ecd92437

commit_message:
Omit default_schedule_zone if its not configured

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/551324
- https://review.openstack.org/554925

There are cases where the default AZ is not called 'nova' in
a single AZ environment.  This patch adds the default behavior
of Nova by leaving it empty if it's not used.

For deployers that are using it, it will be added so this
should not break them.

Change-Id: Iacaa9785bf7ec7bebe2e0eb69e304bcfab41df5c
(cherry picked from commit 3de3c3797591be416964bcf80ef6668bf44ca0de)

commit_message:
Add additional-default-policy-roles spec

Currently we only really have a global admin or not global admin in the
default policy file. This builds on the previous work of
policy-remove-scope-checks and looks at deciding if each API is either a
read API, a write API or an admin API.

blueprint additional-default-policy-roles

Change-Id: Ib4cc7141d900881a7dc20842eb5d68eb90521fdd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/72/427872/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Policy Cleanup (Pike) ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/policy-cleanup-pike Many operators complain of being unable to modify the policy settings in Nova. Given these are not documented, inconsistently named, and generally hard to understand, this should be no surprise. Here is the plan to do better by: TODO - summarize changes here. Problem description =================== Deployers find it hard to modify our RBAC controls through the policy.yaml. In Newton, all policy rules are now defined in code. This lets us now move to evolve the policy file into a more useful position. One reason why deployers want to modify policy is because the default RBAC rules we ship with are extremely primitive. If we have richer rules, people will only need to tweak the policy config so the role names match the default roles, rather than having to hand role a totally custom policy file. Here are few of the niggles we need to iron out: * policy names relate to old code module names, not the REST API * unit tests work against a fake policy file, rather than the in code default * there is a default target where it makes most policy rules a noop * there are no docs for any of the rules * we need to be able to deprecate and rename rules like we do configuration * policy is sometimes too flexible and leads to a lack of interop, while API discoverability will help, there are other things we can do * Policy checks for project membership are hardcoded in the DB layer For the moment, we are not considering hierarchical tenancy. Use Cases --------- Here we will talk about the roles we want to create inside our default policy file: * Project observer (PO): monitoring applications may want to get a list of all the servers in a project, this observer role should allow that kind of thing * Project member (PM): this is the current default, they have full CRUD access to the servers resource, and access to all user facing operations. * Operator observer (OO): this is someone who can look at the servers in any project and list any users keypairs, but they can't make changes. * Operator member (OM): has all the access of Operator observer, but also can do operations like live-migration, and migration. But they are not able to do destructuive things like delete a server. * Nova Admin (NA): this is someone who is able to do everything in the Nova system, although its generally not possible to create things in another project. TODO - what is the keystone model for these? TODO - common deployment patterns * default, can just be PM and NA (or just NA) * everyone is an admin in their own project (self service cloud) * complicated / custom Proposed change =============== Default policy target and unit tests ------------------------------------ Currently many operations default to admin_or_owner, but we don't actually specify the policy target in the policy check call. This means most rules fall back the default target, which means the policy turns into a check for "any authenticated user". So we should stop the policy check having an optional target, every call should explicitly specify a target. At the same time, we should revisit the unit tests. They haven't spotted this massive problem, and as such we should look at some new unit tests for the policy checks, that test the default policy rule. In some cases where we added the ability to specify "user_id" based policy rules, we should ensure those work by overriding the policy file. Standardization: Renaming, documenting and rescoping ---------------------------------------------------- So here the plan is to go through every policy rule, and made it match the new standardized approach to policy. Lets consider the servers resource: * POST /servers * This is a "Create" operation (scoped in my own project) * PO: False, PM: True, OO: False, OM: False, NA: False * new rule: compute:servers:create * NOTE: its interesting that * GET /servers * This is a "Read" operation, scoped in my own project * PO: True, PM: True, OO: True, OM: True, NA: True * new rule: compute:servers:read * same is used by /server/<id> and /servers/details, etc * GET /servers?project_id=<not_my_project> * This is a "Read" operation, scoped outside my own project * PO: False, PM: False, OO: True, OM: True, NA: True * new rule: compute:servers:read_all * PUT /servers/<id> * This is an "Update" operation * PO: False, PM: False, OO: False, OM: False, NA: True * new rule: compute:servers:update * DELETE /servers/<id> * This is a "Delete" operation * PO: False, PM: True, OO: False, OM: False, NA: True * new rule: compute:servers:delete * POST /servers/<id>/action {"createImage": {...}} * This is a non-destructive operation on a server * PO: False, PM: True, OO: False, OM: True, NA: True * new rule: compute:servers:action:create_image = rule:compute:servers:action * POST /servers/<id>/action {"os-migrateLive": {...}} * This is an operation that relates to hosts, and operators need to use * PO: False, PM: False, OO: False, OM: True, NA: True * new rule: compute:servers:action:migrate_live = rule:compute:servers:admin-action * GET /flavors * PO: True, PM: True, OO: True, OM: True, NA: True * new rule: compute:flavors:read * same rule is used for GET /flavors/<id> * POST /flavors * PO: False, PM: False, OO: False, OM: True, NA: True * new rule: compute:flavors:create * delete gets same defaults for rule: compute:flavors:delete We should go through the whole API ensuring things are named in a similar way, and we consider the defaults relative to the same set of default roles. Remove DB hardcoding Alternatives ------------ What other ways could we do this thing? Why aren't we using those? This doesn't have to be a full literature review, but it should demonstrate that thought has been put into why the proposed solution is an appropriate one. Data model impact ----------------- Changes which require modifications to the data model often have a wider impact on the system. The community often has strong opinions on how the data model should be evolved, from both a functional and performance perspective. It is therefore important to capture and gain agreement as early as possible on any proposed changes to the data model. Questions which need to be addressed by this section include: * What new data objects and/or database schema changes is this going to require? * What database migrations will accompany this change. * How will the initial set of new data objects be generated, for example if you need to take into account existing instances, or modify other existing data describe how that will work. REST API impact --------------- Each API method which is either added or changed should have the following * Specification for the method * A description of what the method does suitable for use in user documentation * Method type (POST/PUT/GET/DELETE) * Normal http response code(s) * Expected error http response code(s) * A description for each possible error code should be included describing semantic errors which can cause it such as inconsistent parameters supplied to the method, or when an instance is not in an appropriate state for the request to succeed. Errors caused by syntactic problems covered by the JSON schema definition do not need to be included. * URL for the resource * URL should not include underscores, and use hyphens instead. * Parameters which can be passed via the url * JSON schema definition for the request body data if allowed * Field names should use snake_case style, not CamelCase or MixedCase style. * JSON schema definition for the response body data if any * Field names should use snake_case style, not CamelCase or MixedCase style. * Example use case including typical API samples for both data supplied by the caller and the response * Discuss any policy changes, and discuss what things a deployer needs to think about when defining their policy. Example JSON schema definitions can be found in the Nova tree http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas Note that the schema should be defined as restrictively as possible. Parameters which are required should be marked as such and only under exceptional circumstances should additional parameters which are not defined in the schema be permitted (eg additionaProperties should be False). Reuse of existing predefined parameter types such as regexps for passwords and user defined names is highly encouraged. Security impact --------------- Describe any potential security impact on the system. Some of the items to consider include: * Does this change touch sensitive data such as tokens, keys, or user data? * Does this change alter the API in a way that may impact security, such as a new way to access sensitive information or a new way to login? * Does this change involve cryptography or hashing? * Does this change require the use of sudo or any elevated privileges? * Does this change involve using or parsing user-provided data? This could be directly at the API level or indirectly such as changes to a cache layer. * Can this change enable a resource exhaustion attack, such as allowing a single API interaction to consume significant server resources? Some examples of this include launching subprocesses for each connection, or entity expansion attacks in XML. For more detailed guidance, please see the OpenStack Security Guidelines as a reference (https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Security/Guidelines). These guidelines are a work in progress and are designed to help you identify security best practices. For further information, feel free to reach out to the OpenStack Security Group at openstack-security@lists.openstack.org. Notifications impact -------------------- Please specify any changes to notifications. Be that an extra notification, changes to an existing notification, or removing a notification. Other end user impact --------------------- Aside from the API, are there other ways a user will interact with this feature? * Does this change have an impact on python-novaclient? What does the user interface there look like? Performance Impact ------------------ Describe any potential performance impact on the system, for example how often will new code be called, and is there a major change to the calling pattern of existing code. Examples of things to consider here include: * A periodic task might look like a small addition but if it calls conductor or another service the load is multiplied by the number of nodes in the system. * Scheduler filters get called once per host for every instance being created, so any latency they introduce is linear with the size of the system. * A small change in a utility function or a commonly used decorator can have a large impacts on performance. * Calls which result in a database queries (whether direct or via conductor) can have a profound impact on performance when called in critical sections of the code. * Will the change include any locking, and if so what considerations are there on holding the lock? Other deployer impact --------------------- Discuss things that will affect how you deploy and configure OpenStack that have not already been mentioned, such as: * What config options are being added? Should they be more generic than proposed (for example a flag that other hypervisor drivers might want to implement as well)? Are the default values ones which will work well in real deployments? * Is this a change that takes immediate effect after its merged, or is it something that has to be explicitly enabled? * If this change is a new binary, how would it be deployed? * Please state anything that those doing continuous deployment, or those upgrading from the previous release, need to be aware of. Also describe any plans to deprecate configuration values or features. For example, if we change the directory name that instances are stored in, how do we handle instance directories created before the change landed? Do we move them? Do we have a special case in the code? Do we assume that the operator will recreate all the instances in their cloud? Developer impact ---------------- Discuss things that will affect other developers working on OpenStack, such as: * If the blueprint proposes a change to the driver API, discussion of how other hypervisors would implement the feature is required. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: <launchpad-id or None> Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ * Include specific references to specs and/or blueprints in nova, or in other projects, that this one either depends on or is related to. * If this requires functionality of another project that is not currently used by Nova (such as the glance v2 API when we previously only required v1), document that fact. * Does this feature require any new library dependencies or code otherwise not included in OpenStack? Or does it depend on a specific version of library? Testing ======= Please discuss the important scenarios needed to test here, as well as specific edge cases we should be ensuring work correctly. For each scenario please specify if this requires specialized hardware, a full openstack environment, or can be simulated inside the Nova tree. Please discuss how the change will be tested. We especially want to know what tempest tests will be added. It is assumed that unit test coverage will be added so that doesn't need to be mentioned explicitly, but discussion of why you think unit tests are sufficient and we don't need to add more tempest tests would need to be included. Is this untestable in gate given current limitations (specific hardware / software configurations available)? If so, are there mitigation plans (3rd party testing, gate enhancements, etc). Documentation Impact ==================== Which audiences are affected most by this change, and which documentation titles on docs.openstack.org should be updated because of this change? Don't repeat details discussed above, but reference them here in the context of documentation for multiple audiences. For example, the Operations Guide targets cloud operators, and the End User Guide would need to be updated if the change offers a new feature available through the CLI or dashboard. If a config option changes or is deprecated, note here that the documentation needs to be updated to reflect this specification's change. References ========== Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable. Examples of what you could include are: * Links to mailing list or IRC discussions * Links to notes from a summit session * Links to relevant research, if appropriate * Related specifications as appropriate (e.g. if it's an EC2 thing, link the EC2 docs) * Anything else you feel it is worthwhile to refer to History ======= Optional section intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Pike - Introduced

commit_message:
WIP: Support for forbidden traits in placement

This is a spike which provides support for forbidden traits in the
placement API. Where the 'required' param is used in either GET
/resource_providers or GET /allocation_candidates if a trait is prefixed
with '!' then that trait should not show up in the providers used in the
results.

This code will be broken up into multiple patches as it matures. Working
in a lump was easier because I was coming at it from gabbi tests.

In /allocation_candidates this does not currently work with nested
resource providers. When nested does work, there will need to be
some adjustments and discussions about what forbidden should mean with
regard to the tree of resources.

RequestGroup parsing is only used by /allocation_candidates, not
/resource_providers. There is conflict detection (required and forbidden
of the same trait in the same group is an error).

Some duplicate code for '_get_provider_ids_having_any_trait' and
'_all_traits' has been combined to one method that does 'all' if an
optional paramter is True (default to True).

Todo:

* non-gabbi functional tests
* microversion handling and documentation
* api-ref update

blueprint placement-forbidden-traits

Change-Id: I6501fca352aa3faac75e66c66c7505e2c1f66d5e

added_lines: def test_forbidden_one_group(self): qs = ('resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:2048' '&required=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1,!CUSTOM_SWITCH_BIG') expected = [ pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=False, resources={ 'VCPU': 2, 'MEMORY_MB': 2048, }, required_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', }, forbidden_traits={ 'CUSTOM_SWITCH_BIG', } ), ] self.assertRequestGroupsEqual(expected, self.do_parse(qs)) def test_forbidden_conflict(self): qs = ('resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:2048' '&required=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1,!CUSTOM_PHYSNET1') expected_message = ('Conflict required and forbidden traits found ' 'in the following traits keys: required') exc = self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.do_parse, qs) self.assertEqual(expected_message, str(exc))

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Id195a44f356607f68dd88246f09ae0a4f46ca64a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Refactor backup and restore docs

This patch will refactor the current documentation
we have to run an Undercloud backup and restore and
will provide new documentation for the Overcloud control
plane backup and restore.

Change-Id: I8a8bbabed007fef5cbe9290db370b65464908475

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I1c69e5d82410cd6245a7427a67ce741d82324d51
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 04:06:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/d582396c1688870644f946e4ffddf8fd03de4596', 'message': 'Fix kube token create error

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-27 06:28:52.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/kubernetes/kube/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/d68f0974796d7aac325327c5b0dde68bcac3668b', 'message': "Fix kube token create with string join error

This patch fix token format error, string join error,
Example:
   token_id = 'ufxq7o'
   token_secret = 'yz7till9p24zb0dj'
   token = '.'.join([token_id, token_secret])
The token value is 'ufxq7o.yz7till9p24zb0dj'

Change-Id: Ia8414037a1291415272b591a9a2e5a7fa5347e41
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kube token create with string join error

This patch fix token format error, string join error,
Example:
   token_id = 'ufxq7o'
   token_secret = 'yz7till9p24zb0dj'
   token = '.'.join([token_id, token_secret])
The token value is 'ufxq7o.yz7till9p24zb0dj'

Change-Id: Ia8414037a1291415272b591a9a2e5a7fa5347e41

commit_message:
Consume ceph-container project's new style of tags

The ceph-container project is moving to a new style of tags for
Ceph. Update scenario001/004 to pull Ceph container images using
the new tags.

Change-Id: I2a6a7c5fb5148e951f85850c09be7cbb59fce0f8
(cherry picked from commit 09ff488f0df36df321e5d711f8b49c343013f12d)

commit_message:
Add healthcheck script for libvirtd

This patch adds script for docker health check of nova-libvirt container.
The script checks API service using virsh.

Change-Id: I757d53189f5819bb3a0e7bebe277353f3460738d

commit_message:
Prevent overwriting of last_error on cleaning failures

This changes moves the call to tear_down_cleaning to before we set
the last_error and maintenance_reason fields. Thus we avoid
overwriting last_error by e.g. power actions.

Related-Bug: #1588901
Change-Id: Ia448431a2922ea6f7adc27065dbcab1ba8358daa

commit_message:
Cleanup old MariaDB cruft from override file

Kolla is switching to MariaDB package provided by RDO instead of
mariadb.org. We do not need to overwrite the package names in our
overrides file anymore.

commit_message:
Cleanup swift/common/middleware/s3api/test dir

The scripts in the dir was used to setup functional tests
but they will be never used in swift upstream so let's cleanup
those scripts.

The configs for ceph-s3-test would be useful to make non-voting
gate in the swift upstream, this patch moves them into doc/s3api/conf
dir that is not included source code tree, anyway.

Change-Id: I608ed3a620478bc4ab2fdd8901ea987e356298c9

commit_message:
Use endpoint rather than url in clouds.yaml with no keystone

When keystone is not in use, the clouds.yaml file generated by bifrost
uses an auth_type of "none". This does not appear to work, and results
in the following error (even with OS_CLOUD=bifrost):

Missing parameter(s):
Set a cloud-name with --os-cloud or OS_CLOUD

This change modifies the "url" parameter to be "endpoint", which works
correctly.

Change-Id: I9b84739dcb90b6482b332676244c68642042dfd4
Closes-Bug: #1754070
(cherry picked from commit e1a167a3bbc6b2f84b040f54ae0ef9b22d252eb4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/17/556017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove extra ssh args passed to ansible

These are already set in the default ansible configuration file that is
generated with write_default_ansible_cfg() prior to running ansible,
and are thus redundant.

Change-Id: Ie756280c8b58354bef43cf92df1efb960ae4801d

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I567e61fa5aaa3101135684ff3d8c1370d8acb20b

commit_message:
Fix bashate "local hides exit status" warnings

Promote "local hides exit status" (E042) to error and fix issues found
(this is inline with what we do in devstack).

Change-Id: Idd784af066db80bb67792da3dd0aa0ae4c8475db

commit_message:
Create the ara-plugins project

This follows up on the change to create the ara-web project [1] and the
split of the ARA components in the upcoming release.

We are splitting the components in order to allow indenpendant
installation and deployment for each component.

The ara-plugins project will contain the plugins, modules and callbacks
for ARA.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528358/

Change-Id: I2d345414d16d4f08f9d4570a92f24b7a43203e66

Create the ara-clients project

split of the ARA components in the upcoming release.

commit_message:
Create the ara-server project

This follows up on the change to create the ara-web project [1] and the
split of the ARA components in the upcoming release.

We are splitting the components in order to allow indenpendant
installation and deployment for each component.

The ara-server project will contain the backend/model and API for ARA.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528358/

Change-Id: I9d40e00588b03da6aca55e1ad1c7009635f3e4ec

commit_message:
Correctly set NeutronMl2PluginBase for OVN scenario

OVN configuration was not done when deployed with
scenario007 as default for NeutronMl2PluginBase was
used which is neutron-plugin-ml2.yaml. This patch
fixes this to use neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml which
correctly configures neutron for ovn metadata.

Change-Id: I7cadd0567951b85c1ba69d4b4843ee29b67e7a11
Closes-Bug: #1757134

commit_message:
Add tripleo-upgrade specific parameters.

In order to run some of the needed
tripleo-upgrade tasks, we need to set
tripleo_ci variable, as the role is being
used for downstream as well as upstream
testing and this is the flag to run specific
TripleO CI tasks.

Change-Id: I15530dce10d3e2bd08f69e6d71ca0ba95a27b30c

commit_message:
Fix minor updates for deployed server environments

We were getting permission denied errors in CI for minor
update. Nowadays we should be using tripleo-admin user when connecting
to overcloud via ssh. Heat-admin works only when the servers were
deployed as part of the overcloud Heat stack.

Change-Id: I1ec66886d6d61ccf528e5e27872cf68c7a603727
Closes-Bug: #1757090

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is currently
unused, we can set the functional test to
non-voting in order to allow general pattern
changes to be implemented without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556279
Change-Id: I3f795e59f1b58862f2f196b2ac06d9891c3a17fa
(cherry picked from commit 00e1b9575e3786cec3f62676e9c6d270cf116398)

commit_message:
Add sphinx built manpages if they exist

Rather than statically listing manpages in the setup.cfg file which
would break if sphinx hasn't run at setup.py sdist time, look to see if
any exist in the sphinx build-dir location, and if so assume that the
user wants to install them. Because they almost certainly do.

Change-Id: Ia57133fdfa5c7b2a3400bbb986beb1029f97b196
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/99/184899/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sphinx_config = self._global_config.get('build_sphinx', dict()) sphinx_build_dir = sphinx_config.get('build-dir', None) if sphinx_build_dir and os.path.exists(sphinx_build_dir): manpages = os.listdir(os.path.join(sphinx_build_dir, 'man')) else: manpages = [] manpages.extend(self.pbr_config['manpages'].split()) manpages = list(set(manpages)) for manpage in list(set(manpages)):
deleted_lines: manpages = self.pbr_config['manpages'] for manpage in manpages.split():

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Change-Id: I53d0840ab61f5d63620875dc0ffdce16ed97190e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556281

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634
(cherry picked from commit 2b51da5f0a3a1c088c5e8c27a2907e781ac6a131)

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Change-Id: I53d0840ab61f5d63620875dc0ffdce16ed97190e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556280
